name: Kalaloch Campground

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had camping trip to remember. We arrived early on a Friday. There were a lot of spots to choose from but ended up in A11. We opted for this one over a ocean front one because it was large and there were trees to hang my hammock up on. You could still hear the ocean and see it if you stood on the table. Seems as if the ocean front sites are made more for trailer campers vs tent campers. We spent most of our first day at the beach down the road called beach 2. We had the beach to ourselves. We ended up cutting our trip a day short due to the night and morning of torrential rains. On check out morning we were in the process of packing up our stuff and the camp hosts came by and reminded us the check out time was 11. It was 11:15 and there were only 12 other campers in the whole loop. I am sure that giving us an extra 45 minuets (really that’s all it took) did not make any difference in the off chance someone wanted out spot for the night. Overall our stay was great and we will be back. If you are staying in late June you need to make a reservation. We did not because of the time of year we stayed.
reviews.title: Great camping trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This campground would indeed appear on a list of the most scenic; especially if you're lucky and can grab an ocean view slot - all but two were taken when we arrived last week. I think reservations start in late June. But for just $14, you get decent hard and level pitches, good spaces, with plenty of washroom facilities dotted around. Good base for exploring the coastline here and venturing into Quinault which is only 30mins away.
reviews.title: splendid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in the 2 bed cabins for 2 nights. Having looked on line at the map of the cabins we booked ours to be overlooking the ocean and beach. The cabins are not the height of luxury but the beds were comfy and having a full kitchen was handy to cook for ourselves one night. The views from our windows and sliding patio door were great. There are paths that lead down to the beach which is strewn with fallen trees. Its an enjoyable stroll along the sand what ever the weather. We had sun, rain, wind and fog. The lodge has a store to buy groceries and a restaurant that has fab views if you are lucky enough to get a table by the picture windows. We asked for 1 when we booked for dinner earlier in the day. We think the lodge is a good place to stay although its not cheap to experience the wild Pacific ocean.
reviews.title: National Park Lodge cabins.

reviews.text: Perhaps one of the most scenic campgrounds in America, Kalaloch is located directly on the Pacific Ocean. Nice campsites located either right near the ocean or in the trees. Nice, clean campground and spectacular views. Have fun!
reviews.title: Best Campground

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the Kalaloch (pronounced Klaylock if you don't feel like being corrected when you call on the phone for reservations) cabins that lines the bluff overlooking the Pacific Ocean. The whole campground is situated in a spectacular site. The view is dramatic and beautiful. The cabin itself is very very rustic and not cheap. We paid over $250 a nite when all is said and done - there are extra park fees and such added when you actually pay.
reviews.title: Kalaloch

reviews.text: My husband and I have been tent and RV camping here since we were married 33 years ago. We brought our children every year as our family grew. We love the beach, rain, wind and sun. As we prepare for our anual trip once more we anticipate over 25 family members to camp in the Kalaloch campground with us. We come prepared for cool damp weather and windy beaches. The misty rain forest is beautiful because of the high amount of rainfall. When the sun occasionally bares it's bright face, the Kalaloch world is gorgeous. Lots of wild lift to be found in the intertidal zone, as well.
reviews.title: My family's favorite place on planet earth!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'll be back this year and the next with our children, grandchildren, nieces, nephews and various surrogate family members hunting for the pirate treasure that Black Bart and his scoundrels leave for us somewhere on the beach every year.
reviews.title: Best car camping I've experienced yet.

reviews.text: I normally avoid car accessible campgrounds, but the overall feel and proximity to the ocean has definitely made this a destination of mine for future visits to the peninsula. I do recommend jumping online when the sites become available to assure a site with an ocean view; I unfortunately wasn't so lucky, but I still had a great time. The beach is just a rustic staircase away, and fires on the beach at night are permitted (but for some reason no one was down there at night which actually made it a better experience). The campground is centrally located so we were able to jump around to the Hoh, Ruby Beach (not as great as its made out to be), Rialto (hole in the wall) and the La Push beaches (first, second and third). Beach 4 is also just up the road ( a few miles) and has great tide pools. I'll be going back to Kalaloch for sure.
reviews.title: Beautiful Place to Camp!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Incredible view of/access to the beach. This was our favorite part about the Olympic Peninsula!
reviews.title: I could've camped here forever!!!!

reviews.text: Amazing!!! We traveled all over the west coast in July and camped from Nevada to Washington, and this was by far my favorite place. I had booked the site on the internet in March and wasn't really sure what to expect. The online description said "waterview", so we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived to see that the site was directly across from the beach. Not only was there a great view, but we were also close to the bathroom and had a ton more privacy than those directly on the water. After scoping out other sites, we also learned that our site was really big!!! We have a small tent, but we seriously could've set up 3. The walk down to the beach from our site was less than 3 minutes. It was really just perfect!!! We will definitely be staying there again and hopefully at the same site. Definitely recommend Kalaloch!! Try for site D32.
reviews.title: Wonderful - misty, chilly, mysterious and beautiful!

reviews.text: I love Kalaloch, it's one of my favorite places to camp in Wa. My family went almost every summer when I was a kid. The beach is a huge expanse and there's also a creek the empty's out at the beach. We used to use random camping junk to make boats for our family to race down the creek. I highly suggest Kalaloch as a camping destination.
reviews.title: Camping there since I was a kid

reviews.text: If you are in the Olympic National Park area and looking for a great oceanfront campground your search is over. This campground situated along highway 101 has won numerous awards for best scenic camping and you will see why. Great bluff view with stairs down to wide open beach. Bathrooms are clean and rangers regularly patrol. Great find and a one of a kind. Cheapest oceanfront view you can get!
reviews.title: Great Ocean Views, Fantastic Wide Open Beach, Nice Camping

reviews.text: My girlfriend and I went out to kalaloch at the end of September because we just needed to get away. The weather said heavy rain and wind, and it was when we got there. The campground still had a lot of people in it but we still got a ocean front campsite right on the bluff. Everything about this place is gorgeous even in the wind and rain. We threw on our rain gear and had a lovely 2 days exploring the beaches north of the campground And all the tide pools at beach 4. It was an awesome time in the rain and wind and I can't wait to go back in the sun!
reviews.title: Beautiful even in a downpour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last week my husband and I went to Kalaloch for the first time. The sound of the ocean, the salty air, campfires, walks on the beach, etc. were a recipe for relaxation. We're already planning our next trip there!
reviews.title: Ultimate Relaxation
Beauty and Solitude
reviews.text: Who would guess that a campground that has 160 sites could be so peaceful. The sites are large and most of them heavily forested. The campground has several areas where stairs take you right down to the beach. There are hikes from the beach and no houses around to obstruct view. This campground you can reserve sites at, but I would do so well in advanced. Pack the mosquito spray & wear it when you are anywhere but the beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights here. The beach is as everyone says, just stunning. The weather was a little iffy, and we had a lot of rain, but it is so moody and misty there it kind of feels right to be a bit damp! The toilets were clean and had flush and potable water. No showers, though you can shower just 6 miles away. One down side for us was our site was literally next to highway 101 and very large logging trucks were hammering past the tent at 5am, so I would try and get a pitch away from the road if you have a choice.
reviews.title: Stunning location for tent camping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took our first trip to Washington and spent 2 nights camping at Kalaloch. We had an amazing time. The campground is beautiful and better than we imagined. We were just across the road from the beach and had the most beautiful view. Our campsite had more covering than we expected, which we were very happy about because we were alittle worried about the rain. Although we didn't need to be as we had 3 days of no rain amazingly. Although if it had rained there would have been enough covering from the trees that we would have stayed dry, at least at our site. The only downside to the place is that they do not have showers, but that's easy to get over with how beautiful and peaceful it is. The location is great and we enjoyed the nearby beaches. We would highly recommend Ruby Beach and Second Beach. Second Beach had hundreds and hundreds of starfish of all different colors. It was an amazing site. We would highly recommend this campground to anyone and we definitely will return.
reviews.title: Best camping experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just NEEDED to get away for a weekend in our new little pop-top camper. We chose this spot because of the reviews. It was worth it. Yes it rained and it was cold, but the campsite was still full! It is beautiful and the beach is so amazing. The bathrooms were basic and clean. NICE CAMPSITE.
reviews.title: nice even in winter

reviews.text: Make sure you come during the Summer to avoid a lot of rain and know that there is a good chance that it will be overcast, foggy and damp. Nicely set up, not too close to the other campsites, pretty clean restrooms, no showers, and good programs run by park rangers. We recommend seeing the 8 PM presentations at the amphitheater each night.....interesting. Campground is close to the Kalaloch lodge so if you need any supplies or just want to eat at a restaurant or use a very clean restroom then you are about a 15 minute walk away.
reviews.title: Beauty in the Rain Forest near the beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be warned, for reservations you must sign up the MINUTE they open the website. We ended up with site A004 near highway 101 and the cars and especially the timber trucks could be pretty loud at night when they went by. Although, it was not unbearable just a little annoying.
reviews.title: Ocean Vistas!

aka: Kalaloch Campground Hotel Olympic National Park
